Promoted.title: Online.io - Earn Tokens to Browse The Internet
Promoted.body:
Online.io is implementing a decentralized ecosystem which combines all necessary features for a faster, safer, and more private Internet browsing. Moreover, through the Online.io platform developed by using the most advanced Blockchain technology, both internet end users and website operators will benefit alike.

The Online (OIO) token is a unique digital asset that will unleash the Internet from ads, malware and tracking software, leading to a more enjoyable and secure browsing experience, with sizeable benefits for both web operators and end users.

Data.title: Bitmain Approaching 51% of Network Hashrate for Bitcoin
Data.body: Bitmain, the largest manufacturer of ASICs, is getting close to 51% of Bitcoin’s network hashrate as its two subordinates reached close to 42% last week. Data.title: UK’s Cryptocurrency Task Force Concerned Over Recent Exchange Hacks
Data.body: The latest hacks in the cryptocurrency industry have had some British MPs questioning whether customers’ funds are safe. The word “hack” has the ability to send fear into the hearts of many a cryptocurrency holder. Were you affected? Are your funds safe? Will you be compensated if you’re a victim? Data.title: US Secret Service Wants Anonymous Cryptocurrencies Tackled by Congress
Data.body: A lot of crypto enthusiasts desire privacy when using their coins, but law enforcement has other ideas. The US Secret Service recently asked Congress to tackle anonymous cryptocurrencies. One of the original benefits touted about cryptocurrency was that one could be completely anonymous in how it was used. Such has proven not to be the...

Data.title: Chinese Police Arrest Crypto Miner for Power Theft
Data.body: Chinese police have arrested a suspect on charges of alleged power theft, seizing 200 bitcoin and ethereum mining computers in the process.

Data.title: South Korea to Invest $230M in Blockchain Technology Development
Data.body: The Ministry of Science and ICT of South Korea revealed a Blockchain Technology Development Strategy on June 21st earmarking a total of 230 billion Won (over of $200M USD) for the development of blockchain-based technology.    Multiple Initiatives The Government announced that it plans to finish the fundraising by 2022. In an attempt to further the development and advancement of blockchain-based technology, the Korean government plans to nurture over 10,000 industry professionals and 100 companies. Data.title: Vietnam To Ban Bitcoin Miner Imports, Increases Scrutiny
Data.body: Vietnam’s Ministry of Finance has recently proposed a temporary ban on bitcoin mining machine imports, to “improve the management of bitcoin and cryptocurrency transactions.” The country’s government is reportedly working to increase scrutiny over BTC transactions.

Data.title: Polkadot Developer Robert Habermeier Wins Prestigious Thiel Fellowship
Data.body: Polkadot developer Robert Habermeier has become the latest cryptocurrency developer to win a prestigious fellowship from the Thiel Foundation, which was founded by PayPal co-founder and bitcoin bull Peter Thiel. Every year, the Thiel Foundation 20 to 25 entrepreneurs under the age of 23 and awards them $100,000 over a two-year period. The foundation encourages its fellows

Data.title: On Nick Szabo's Criticism of EOS' Governance
Data.body: Nick Szabo, the Intellectual Father of Cryptocurrencies and Smart Contracts has expressed his opinions on the EOS constitution in a recent tweet thread. Mr Szabo is an advocate of algorithmic settlements which never require arbitrary and potentially flawed or corrupted human intervention. He believes "the EOS 'constitution' is socially unscalable and a security hole".

Data.title: Bitmain Approaching 51% of Total Bitcoin Network Hashrate
Data.body: Bitcoin Mining giant Bitmain has mined 42% of all Bitcoin blocks this past week, steadily moving closer to controlling a majority 51% of th network hash rate.  Bitmain Moves Closer to 51% ASIC manufacturer and cryptocurrency mining giant Bitmain — claimed 42% of the total blocks found on the Bitcoin network from the past week. BTC.com and AntPool, which are both owned by Bitmain, currently comprise 26.6% and 15.3% of the network hash rate, respectively.Read More

Data.title: So Hard to Say Goodbye: Blockchain.Info Goes Dot Com

Data.title: Most Prolific Editor of Bitcoin's Wikipedia Page Is a Czech Grandpa Who Does Not Own Any Bitcoin
Data.body: Ladislav Mecir, a 57-year-old Czech grandfather, is the most active contributor to Bitcoin’s Wikipedia page. He surprisingly does not own any Bitcoins and is not involved in cryptocurrency mining. A lot of what people know about Bitcoin is because of him.

Data.title: John McAfee “Gets Real” About Bitcoin’s Price Decline, Remains Bullish
Data.body: Eccentric cybersecurity pioneer and bitcoin bull John McAfee recently “got real” about the flagship cryptocurrency’s price decline, by pointing out that one year ago today the cryptocurrency wasn’t trading anywhere close its current near $6,000 price.

Data.title: Blockchain Academic Research Bolstered by Stanford’s New Blockchain Research Center
Data.body: Stanford University has launched an initiative that will be dedicated to the research and development of blockchain technology.
